column5: Hi there, I have spent many hours looking for hints of where trout are in cambridge but I can never seem to find any. I have tried many sections of the grand river and a few creeks people have mentioned to me but no luck. Any help or suggestions would be appreciated.
I second that lol i live in Cambridge to but have only managed pike and smallies in the grand and speed
You might try Sobey`s   sorry couldn`t resist!!!  Good luck in your quest!
I would hope that no one would actually post such sensitive information on an open forum.  Best advice, a map, time and leg work.
I didnt know Cambridge had a Sobeys...huh....next time im down there ill check it out...  This post was only made so i can keep my 2.78 post average for the day
Keep walking!  You'll find them eventually.
Definitely... my daughters grocery store of choice when Dad is buying. Up on the hill in West Galt. Has a great fresh fish counter I might add..
Haha I like.the fact that there is a sense of humor on this site however there is an I M you could.send lol or better yet meet up go out for a day. Its.not my post but it is a question i have lol

My understanding is if you aren't fly fishing you aren't likely to ever get them in that area.... As for spots used to be just like any creek trout.  Anywhere there is a rock for them to sit behind as the current goes by you might find one. If there are over hanging branches that will almost certainly cause you to cast into them EVEN better. If you can find a spot where the temp of water drops a few degrees due to depth or shade would probably help too.
I've seen guys fly fish the Elora Gorge for browns, I think.
